caption:
This photograph captures an agricultural scene set in a vast, open field under a clear blue sky. The foreground shows a man standing on the bed of a dark blue Ford F-250 truck. The truck looks to be from the late 1970s or early 1980s, and it is parked on tilled soil. The man, dressed in work attire consisting of a light jacket, jeans, and a cap, appears to be handling burlap sacks that may contain agricultural products or supplies. 

In the midground, a large yellow harvesting machine is actively working in the field, kicking up dust as it moves. This machine is attached to a long orange trailer, which seems to be collecting whatever is being harvested. The presence of the machine suggests the field is undergoing active agricultural processing.

The background of the photograph features a hilly landscape dotted with some sporadic greenery and small buildings or houses on the horizon, indicating the proximity of a rural community. The overall composition focuses on agricultural activities, highlighting the machinery and the labor involved in farming. The combination of natural landscape and agricultural equipment paints a picture of rural life and farm operation.
title: Truck loaded with seed awaits the bulldozer-pulled spreader. The land is being fertilized and seeded by coal companies which did the strip mining. Off Route #800 near Morristown, Ohio.
